questions.question: The materials used to study history are called ____.
questions.answer: Sources of history

questions.question: Which of the following is a modern source of history?
questions.answer: Photographs

questions.question: Buildings, forts and bridges are which type of sources?
questions.answer: Material sources

questions.question: Newspapers and journals are classified as ____.
questions.answer: Written sources

questions.question: Powadas and folk songs are examples of ____ sources.
questions.answer: Oral

questions.question: Films and sound recordings come under ____ sources.
questions.answer: Audio-visual

questions.question: Museums mainly preserve which type of sources?
questions.answer: Material sources

questions.question: Maps and drawings are included in ____ sources.
questions.answer: Written sources

questions.question: Photographs are useful in history because they provide ____.
questions.answer: Visual information

questions.question: Modern sources of history are ____.
questions.answer: Varied and abundant

questions.answer: Sources of history

questions.question: What are sources of history?
questions.answer: The materials used to study and understand past events are called sources of history.

questions.question: Give two examples of material sources.
questions.answer: Buildings, forts, bridges and monuments are examples of material sources.

questions.question: What are written sources?
questions.answer: Books, newspapers, letters, diaries and official documents are written sources.

questions.question: What are oral sources?
questions.answer: Folk songs, ballads, stories and speeches passed orally are oral sources.

questions.question: Why are audio-visual sources important?
questions.answer: They help us understand historical events by seeing and hearing them directly.
